stories.title: Poor man's VPN (pay for only what you need)

stories.text:
OK. 1. Let's pretend I'm a 5 yo, but I've been around for 45 years. I have only ever used so-call "web2" platforms, and have never in my life coded (accept in a class in hs in the early 90s, would have no idea what to do with a server if I had one, and have never used a platform that didn't just "run" once you downloaded it. In other words, let's assume I'm everyone who's never heard of HN. How would you explain to me how to access (is that even the right word?) a blockchain?

2. This seems like the right time to ask this, as I have a feeling it deals with the same thing. If I wanted to play around with something like this Zooko thing (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=29912396) which I don't necessarily, I just think it's a good example, being the person I mentioned above, how would I do that???

3. Are there books I can read so as not to bother the HN community?
stories.title: Ask HN: How does one “engage”(?) with a block chain?

stories.text: We live in an apartment complex and the router (with access point built-in) provided by our ISP is getting pretty slow and unreliable. Now that working and studying from home are here to stay, I'm planning to buy a new access point for our apartment. With that, how important is having WPA3 especially in my case? The ground floor of our complex are mostly business establishments and we live on the second floor.
stories.title: Should I buy a wireless access point with WPA3 or is WPA2 enough?
